class.name: MySQL
class.description: This module is a wrapper of the Mysql connector for C ++. Supports connections over the internet. It's fully compatible with MariaDB. Supports secure connections (SSL).

method.name: commit
method.description: Makes changes made to the current transaction permanent and visible to other sessions. Also release all InnoDB locks that were set during the current transaction. All savepoints of the current transaction are deleted if you execute a COMMIT.

method.name: connection_start
method.description: Starts the connection. Also returns the status of connection.

method.name: connection_status
method.description: Returns the status of connection.

method.name: connection_stop
method.description: Close the connection. Also returns the status of connection after closed.

method.name: create_savepoint
method.description: Create a savepoint that can be retrieved within a transaction.

method.name: delete_savepoint
method.description: Delete a savepoint.

method.name: execute
method.description: Execute SQL statements. Returns true if the statement was successful.

method.name: execute_prepared
method.description: Execute prepared SQL statements. Returns true if the statement was successful. The values for Prepared Statements must be supplied within an array. Parameters in prepared statements are for data values ONLY. Do not use for object identifiers or any other part of a SQL statement. ONLY data values.

method.name: get_autocommit
method.description: Get auto-commit mode for the current session.

method.name: get_client_info
method.description: Returns the Client information.

method.name: get_client_option
method.description: The method can be used to check the value of connection properties set when establishing a database connection.

method.name: get_database
method.description: Returns the currently selected database.

method.name: get_driver_info
method.description: Returns driver information.

method.name: get_last_error
method.description: Return a Dictionary containing details about the last MySQL exception occurred.

method.name: get_properties_array
method.description: Returns a Dictionary with multiple properties at the same time. [codeblocks] [gdscript] var mysql := MySQL.new() var conn_set := [ "schema", "CLIENT_MULTI_STATEMENTS", "OPT_RECONNECT" ] mysql.get_properties_array(conn_set) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: get_property
method.description: Returns the value of a property.

method.name: get_savepoints
method.description: Returns an Array with all set savepoints.

method.name: get_transaction_isolation
method.description: Get the current transaction Isolation Level.

method.name: query
method.description: Returns an array containing the query result. [code]Sql Statement[/code] SQL statement. The querty it'self. [code]DataFormat[/code] The way each row will be returned. It can be an Array or a Dictionary. [code]return_as_string[/code] If false, the all data is returned as string. If true, the data will be returned as it data type. [code]Metadata[/code] Returns rows containing additional information about the query made.

method.name: query_prepared
method.description: Returns an array containing the query result. The query must be done using prepared statement. [code]Sql Statement[/code] SQL statement. The querty it'self. [code]Values[/code] This Array contains the values that will replace the placeholders on statement. [code]DataFormat[/code] The way each row will be returned. It can be an Array or a Dictionary. [code]return_as_string[/code] If false, the all data is returned as string. If true, the data will be returned as it data type. [code]Metadata[/code] Returns rows containing additional information about the query made. [codeblocks] [gdscript] mysql.query_prepared("SELECT * FROM test_table WHERE id = (?)", [2]) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: rollback
method.description: When a Rollback is used with a savepoint, it rolls back all changes made by the current transaction up to the savepoint. When used without a savepoint name cancels all changes made by the current transaction and release all InnoDB locks that were set during the current transaction. All savepoints of the current transaction are deleted if you execute a ROLLBACK without a savepoint.

method.name: set_autocommit
method.description: Enables or disables the default auto-commit mode for the current session.

method.name: set_credentials
method.description: Quick way to set up a connection.

method.name: set_database
method.description: Select a database.

method.name: set_properties_array
method.description: Set several properties at same time. [codeblocks] [gdscript] var mysql := MySQL.new() var conn_set := { "hostName": my_host_name, "userName": my_user_name, "password": my_password, "schema": "tests", "CLIENT_MULTI_STATEMENTS": true, "OPT_RECONNECT": true } mysql.set_properties_array(conn_set) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: set_property
method.description: Sets a property.

method.name: set_transaction_isolation
method.description: Controls the behavior of locks and versioning of lines and statements.

method.name: update
method.description: Run update statements. Returns the number of modified rows. Run queries using Prepared Statements. Returns the number of modified rows. The values ​​for Prepared Statements must be supplied within an array. Parameters in prepared statements are for data values ONLY. Do not use for object identifiers or any other part of a SQL statement. ONLY data values.

method.name: update_prepared
method.description: Run update prepared statements. Returns the number of modified rows. Run queries using Prepared Statements. Returns the number of modified rows. The values ​​for Prepared Statements must be supplied within an array. Parameters in prepared statements are for data values ONLY. Do not use for object identifiers or any other part of a SQL statement. ONLY data values.
